title: 'Refugees Welcome' Banner Released Across Statue of Liberty
text:
Photo via Ana Paula Hirama/Flickr (CC-BY) Activists show Trump what they think of his immigration ban. 
On Tuesday, activists hung a banner at the base of the Statue of Liberty that read, ‚ÄúRefugees welcome.‚Äù We must heed the words of Lady Liberty: #RefugeesWelcome pic.twitter.com/me5TgDWgQc ‚Äî Alt Lady Liberty (@AltStatLiberty) February 21, 2017 One of the activists involved told Fusion that they were motivated by Trump‚Äôs immigration ban. David says he thinks Trump‚Äôs plan ‚Äúflies in the face of the founding principals of the United States.‚Äù
David, like many who oppose Trump, wanted to send a clear message that immigrants make up a large portion of the United States and are vital not only to the economy but also to our communities. The Statue of Liberty, he thinks, is the best symbol of this. 
While putting the banner up, the activists were apparently met with encouragement from tourists on site, many of whom seemed to be visiting from foreign countries.
